channel.title: CVE Feed for Plainware -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Plainware -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-44040|2024-10-07T12:29:14.631Z -- plainware -- shiftcontroller%20employee%20shift%20scheduling
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Plainware ShiftController Employee Shift Scheduling allows Stored XSS.This issue affects ShiftController Employee Shift Scheduling: from n/a through 4.9.64.

item.title: CVE-2024-9435|2024-10-04T13:42:10.876Z -- plainware -- shiftcontroller%20employee%20shift%20scheduling
item.description: The ShiftController Employee Shift Scheduling plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via URL keys in all versions up to, and including, 4.9.66 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-4733|2024-08-01T20:47:41.758Z -- plainware -- shiftcontroller%20employee%20shift%20scheduling
item.description: The ShiftController Employee Shift Scheduling plugin is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection via deserialization of untrusted input via the `hc3_session`-cookie in versions up to, and including, 4.9.57. This makes it possible for an authenticated attacker with contributor access-level or above to inject a PHP Object. No POP chain is present in the vulnerable plugin. If a POP chain is present via an additional plugin or theme installed on the target system, it could allow the attacker to delete arbitrary files, retrieve sensitive data, or execute code.

item.title: CVE-2024-4733|2024-06-04T17:55:46.072Z -- plainware -- shiftcontroller%20employee%20shift%20scheduling
item.description: The ShiftController Employee Shift Scheduling plugin is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection via deserialization of untrusted input via the `hc3_session`-cookie in versions up to, and including, 4.9.57. This makes it possible for an authenticated attacker with contributor access-level or above to inject a PHP Object. No POP chain is present in the vulnerable plugin. If a POP chain is present via an additional plugin or theme installed on the target system, it could allow the attacker to delete arbitrary files, retrieve sensitive data, or execute code.

This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
